author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
RFK Jr. says it is working with the food industry to remove synthetic food dyes from the food supply by the end of 2026. But dye makers say meeting this deadline safely could take more than six years.

WSJ visited Sensient Technologies, one of the largest natural food color plants in the world, to understand why the 2026 deadline is so hard to achieve and what it takes to create natural food dyes. 

Chapters:
0:00 Natural food dye transitions
0:25 Industry change
1:34 Challenges 
4:25 State legislation

News Explainers
Some days the high-speed news cycle can bring more questions than answers. WSJ’s news explainers break down the day's biggest stories into bite-size pieces to help you make sense of the news.

title: Why the U.S. Quitting Artificial Food Dyes Is So Difficult | WSJ
